    "let @xmath13 be a compact oriented surface of genus @xmath14 with one boundary component and we denote its first integral homology group @xmath15 simply by @xmath16 and let @xmath17 .",
    "we denote by @xmath18 the free graded lie algebra generated by @xmath19 and let @xmath1 be the graded lie algebra consisting of _ symplectic _ derivations of @xmath18 .",
    "let @xmath20 be the ideal consisting of derivations with _ positive _ degrees .",
    "this lie algebra was introduced in the theory of johnson homomorphisms ( see @xcite ) and has been investigated extensively .",
    "we also consider closely related lie algebras , denoted by @xmath6 and @xmath21 which correspond to the cases of a closed surface @xmath8 with and without base point @xmath9 .",
    "let @xmath22 be the symplectic group which we sometimes denote simply by @xmath5 .",
    "if we fix a symplectic basis of @xmath19 , then it can be considered as the standard representation of @xmath22 .",
    "each piece @xmath23 , of the three graded lie algebras , is naturally an @xmath5-module so that it has an irreducible decomposition .",
    "let @xmath24 denote the lie subalgebra of @xmath1 consisting of @xmath5-invariant elements .",
    "we denote by @xmath25 the degree @xmath26 part of this lie subalgebra .",
    "we use similar notations for the other two cases @xmath27 and @xmath7 .    in @xcite a canonical metric on @xmath28",
    "is defined and its application to the tautological algebra of the moduli space of curves is given .",
    "it turns out that this metric can be described as a direct consequence of a result of hanlon and wales @xcite . in section @xmath29 , we first recall this metric and give a quick proof by quoting their result .",
    "now we can consider @xmath30 as a subspace of @xmath31 so that it has the induced metric . to formulate our results , we use the following terminology .",
    "a young diagram @xmath32 is denoted by @xmath33 $ ] @xmath34 and the number of boxes in @xmath32 , namely @xmath35 , is denoted by @xmath36 .",

    "@xmath87 the bracket @xmath88 $ ] is included in a @xmath69-submodule @xmath89 of @xmath90 which is defined by @xmath91 here the condition @xmath92 is given by @xmath93 in particular , the height of such a @xmath94 must satisfy the following inequality @xmath95    @xmath96 the @xmath5-invariant part @xmath88^{\\mathrm{sp}}$ ] of @xmath88 $ ] is included in a submodule @xmath97 of @xmath98 which is defined by @xmath99 here the condition @xmath100 is given by @xmath101 in particular , the @xmath94-coordinate of any element in @xmath88^{\\mathrm{sp}}$ ] vanishes for all @xmath94 such that @xmath102 or @xmath103 .",
    "[ thm : bracket ]    the above result shows that the intersection matrix for the pairings of the bracket operation @xmath104 is , so to speak ,  lower anti - triangular \" with respect to the heights of young diagrams which appear in the @xmath69-irreducible decompositions of @xmath72 s .",
    "furthermore the non - vanishing area is a rather restricted one near the anti - diagonal .",
    "asada - nakamura @xcite proved that there exists a unique copy @xmath105_{\\mathrm{gl}}\\subset \\mathfrak{h}_{g,1}(2k+1)$ ] for any @xmath106 . on the other hand , as an @xmath5-module , we have an @xmath5-irreducible decomposition @xmath107_{\\mathrm{gl}}=[2k+1\\ , 1 ^ 2]_{\\mathrm{sp}}\\oplus [ 2k,1]_{\\mathrm{sp}}\\oplus [ 2k+1]_{\\mathrm{sp}}\\ ] ] for all @xmath108 .",
    "the second wedge product of each of these three irreducible components gives rise to an @xmath5-invariant element contained in @xmath109 .",
    "the above theorem implies that the @xmath32-coordinate of this element vanishes for all @xmath32 with @xmath110 . on the other hand , explicit computation for the case",
    "@xmath111 shows that the @xmath112$]-coordinate does not vanish so that the above theorem gives the best possible result .",
    "proofs of the above theorems are given in section @xmath29 .    in section @xmath113",
    ", we compare the three lie algebras @xmath114 .",
    "these lie algebras are the _ rational _ forms of the corresponding lie algebras @xmath115 which are defined over @xmath116 . in the cases of the corresponding mapping class groups denoted by @xmath117 ,",
    "the relations among them are described by the following two well - known extensions @xmath118 which hold for any @xmath119 . in the cases of the above lie algebras over @xmath116 ,",

    ", we have a direct sum decomposition @xmath127 furthermore there exists an explicit method of determining the @xmath5-irreducible decompositions of the @xmath5-modules @xmath128 and @xmath129 .",

    ", we obtain explicit @xmath5-decompositions of @xmath128 , @xmath129 and @xmath130 for all @xmath131 .",
    "see section @xmath125 for details .",
    "if we apply various contractions to any @xmath69-irreducible summand of @xmath69-irreducible decomposition of @xmath72 , then we obtain various @xmath5-irreducible components .",
    "of course non - isomorphic @xmath69-irreducible summands may produce isomorphic @xmath5-irreducible components .",
    "keeping this fact in mind , to analyze the structure of the lie algebra @xmath1 , we propose to take the process of contractions into consideration .",
    "we formulate this idea in section @xmath132 under the names of _ descendants _ and _ ancestors_. see definition [ def : da ] and theorem [ thm : imtau ] .",
    "in section @xmath11 we give a general method of constructing elements of @xmath0 and by using it , we reveal a considerable difference in property between the _",
    "@xmath5-invariant parts _ of the two lie subalgebras of @xmath1 , one is the ideal @xmath10 and the other is the johnson image @xmath133 . see theorem [ thm : imtauw ] .    by making use of the above results , together with the enomoto - satoh map given in @xcite , we have extended known results considerably to obtain a complete description of the structure of the lie algebra @xmath1 up to degree @xmath11 .",
    "it is summarized in the following theorem and we give more detailed structure theorem for @xmath134 in section 7 ( see theorem [ thm : h6sp ] ) .",

    "details are given in section @xmath192 .    in section @xmath193 , we study the case of genus @xmath12 .",
    "this is motivated by the theory of universal mixed elliptic motives due to hain and matsumoto ( cf .",
    "@xcite ) . they show , among other things , that certain galois obstructions appear in the @xmath5-invariant part @xmath194 .",
    "we begin to study these elements from our point of view ( see theorem [ thm : z5 ] ) . here",
    "the theory of satoh @xcite and enomoto and satoh @xcite play an important role .",
    "finally we mention two reasons why we put an emphasis on the @xmath5-invariant part @xmath24 in our study of the whole lie algebra @xmath1 .",
    "one is that the galois obstructions , predicted by oda and proved by nakamura @xcite and matsumoto @xcite independently , appear in this @xmath5-invariant lie subalgebra .",
    "see a recent survey article @xcite of matsumoto .",
    "the galois obstructions also appear in the genus @xmath12 symplectic derivation algebra as already mentioned above .",
    "the precise description of these obstructions is still a mystery and it should be a very important problem both in number theory and topology .",
    "see also willwacher @xcite for a related work .",
    "the other concerns another important problem of deciding whether the composition @xmath195 is trivial .",
    "this is equivalent to the vanishing of the top homology group of @xmath196 with respect to its virtual cohomological dimension determined by culler and vogtmann @xcite ( see conjecture 1.3 . and remark 1.5 . in @xcite , and as for a recent result on @xmath136 , see @xcite ) .",
    "this is also related to one more mystery in low dimensional topology because we can show that there exists a surjective homomorphism @xmath197 where @xmath198 denotes the group of homology cobordism classes of homology cylinders introduced by garoufalidis and levine @xcite .",
    "it should be a very important problem to determine whether @xmath199 or not .",
    "recall here that cha , friedl and kim @xcite proved that @xmath200 contains @xmath201 as a direct summand .",
    "_ acknowledgement _ the authors would like to thank naoya enomoto and takao satoh for enlightening discussion about the cokernel of the johnson homomorphisms .",
    "thanks are also due to richard hain , makoto matsumoto and hiroaki nakamura for helpful information about the arithmetic mapping class groups .",
    "the first named author would like to thank dan petersen for informing him about a paper @xcite of hanlon and wales .",
    "finally we would like to thank the referee for helpful comments .",

    "in this section , we first recall the canonical metric on @xmath28 introduced in @xcite , together with a few related facts , and then we give proofs of theorems [ thm : ortho],[thm : stable ] and [ thm : bracket ] .    as already mentioned in the introduction , the above canonical metric can be described as a direct consequence of a result of hanlon and wales @xcite . in order to make this paper",
    "self - contained as far as possible , we give a quick proof of the main property of this metric by quoting their result in addition to our own arguments , while we refer to @xcite for more geometric proof .",
    "we begin by recalling a few facts from @xcite .",
    "let @xmath202 denote the set consisting of all the linear chord diagrams with @xmath26 vertices . here",
    "a linear chord diagram with @xmath26 vertices is a partition of the set @xmath203 into @xmath44-tuple @xmath204 of pairs @xmath205 where we assume @xmath206 we may also adopt a simpler notation @xmath207 than the above .",
    "we consider @xmath208 to be a graph with @xmath26 vertices and @xmath44 edges ( chords ) each of which connects @xmath209 with @xmath210 for @xmath211 .",
    "this set @xmath212 has @xmath213 elements and let @xmath214 be the vector space over @xmath215 spanned by @xmath212 . for each linear chord diagram @xmath216 ,",
    "define @xmath217 by permuting the elements @xmath218 in such a way that the @xmath219-th part @xmath220 of this tensor product goes to @xmath221 , where @xmath222 denotes the @xmath223-th component of @xmath224 , and then multiplied by the factor @xmath225 in a dual setting , we can also define @xmath226 by @xmath227 where @xmath228 denotes the intersection number of @xmath229 and @xmath230 as before .",
    "now define a linear mapping @xmath231 by setting @xmath232 .",
    "observe that the symmetric group @xmath233 acts on both of @xmath234 and @xmath28 naturally .",
    "the correspondence @xmath231 is surjective for any @xmath3 and bijective for any @xmath235 .",
    "furthermore this correspondence is  anti \" @xmath233-equivariant in the sense that @xmath236 for any @xmath237 and @xmath238 .",
    "[ prop : lcd ]    the surjectivity follows from a classical result of weyl on symplectic invariants ( see @xcite ) .",
    "the latter part can be shown by comparing the actions of permutations on the symplectic invariant tensors and the linear chord diagrams .",
    "next consider the following two symmetric bilinear pairings @xmath239\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] which are defined by @xmath240 where @xmath241 denotes the number of connected components of the graph @xmath242 ( here we consider interiors of @xmath26 edges to be mutually _ disjoint _ ) .",
    "it is not difficult to check that the above two bilinear pairings correspond to each other under the correspondence @xmath243 , namely we have the following result ( see @xcite@xcite@xcite ) .",
    "the following diagram is commutative @xmath244\\\\ @v{\\phi\\otimes\\phi}vv @vv{\\text{evaluation}}v\\\\ ( h_{\\mathbb{q}}^{\\otimes 2k})^{\\mathrm{sp}}\\otimes ( h_{\\mathbb{q}}^{\\otimes 2k})^{\\mathrm{sp } } @>{\\mu^{\\otimes 2k } } > > { \\mathbb{q}}. \\end{cd}\\ ] ] [ prop : lcdmu ]    to describe the canonical metric , we prepare one more terminology .    for each young diagram @xmath32 ,",
    "let @xmath245 be the number defined by the following formula @xmath246 where @xmath247 denotes the number of columns of @xmath32 which are on the left of the column containing @xmath248 and @xmath249 denotes the number of rows which are above the row containing @xmath248 .",
    "when we specify the genus @xmath3 , we write @xmath250 for @xmath251 which is a polynomial in @xmath3 of degree @xmath252 .",
    "[ def : ev ]    @xmath253}=2g(2g-2)(2g-4)(2g-6),\\quad \\mu_{[1 ^ 4]}=2g(2g+1)(2g+2)(2g+3).\\ ] ]    the intersection matrix of the symmetric bilinear pairing @xmath254 on @xmath234 , with respect to the basis @xmath255 , is positive semi - definite for any @xmath3 , so that it defines a metric on @xmath214 depending on @xmath3 .",
    "furthermore , there exists an orthogonal direct sum decomposition @xmath256 in terms of eigenspaces @xmath257 with eigenvalues @xmath245 .",
    "this decomposition is defined independently of the genus @xmath3 .",
    "with respect to the natural action of @xmath233 on @xmath214 , @xmath257 is an irreducible @xmath233-submodule isomorphic to @xmath258 so that the above orthogonal direct sum decomposition gives also the irreducible decomposition of the @xmath233-module @xmath214 .",
    "[ thm : lcdortho ]    the space @xmath214 as well as the bilinear pairing on it , but with a different sign convention , appeared in the paper @xcite by hanlon and wales in a broader context of brauer s centralizer algebras .",
    "more precisely , they call the linear chord diagram in this paper _ @xmath12-factor _ and they work over the reals @xmath259 . also the bilinear pairings are indexed by a real parameter @xmath260 . they determined the eigenspaces and eigenvalues of the intersection matrix and also the irreducible decomposition of @xmath259 as an @xmath233-module . in order to adapt their result to our context",
    ", we have to put the real parameter to be @xmath261 and then take multiplication by the factor @xmath262 .",
    "then their formula for the eigenvalues becomes the one given in the above definition [ def : ev ] .",
    "thus , to prove the theorem , it remains to show the semi - positivity and orthogonality .",
    "the former property follows from the semi - positivity of the adapted eigenvalues as in definition [ def : ev ] .",
    "the latter property of orthogonality follows from the fact that the correspondence @xmath263 from the set of young diagrams to the set of eigenvalues , considered as polynomials in @xmath3 , is _",
    "injective_. this is because all the eigenvalues are then different each other .",
    "this last claim is proved in @xcite .",
    "we now state the canonical metric on @xmath28 .    for any @xmath3 ,",
    "the symmetric bilinear form @xmath264 on @xmath28 is positive definite so that it defines a metric on this space .",
    "furthermore , there exists an orthogonal direct sum decomposition @xmath265 in terms of eigenspaces @xmath266 with eigenvalues @xmath251 . with respect to the natural action of @xmath233 on @xmath28 , @xmath266 is an irreducible @xmath233-submodule isomorphic to @xmath267 so that the above orthogonal direct sum decomposition gives also the irreducible decomposition of the @xmath233-module @xmath28 .",
    "[ thm : can ]    proposition [ prop : lcdmu ] shows that the homomorphism @xmath243 converts all the relevant structures of @xmath214 into those of @xmath28 _ anti _ @xmath233-equivariantly .",
    "also it is easy to see that the kernel of @xmath243 , for each specific value of @xmath3 , is precisely the direct sum of eigenspaces whose eigenvalues are zero .",
    "hence the claim follows from theorem [ thm : lcdortho ] by applying proposition [ prop : lcdmu ] .",
    "now we are ready to prove theorems [ thm : ortho],[thm : stable ] and [ thm : bracket ] .",
    "as already mentioned , the space @xmath30 can be considered to be a subspace of @xmath268 . by theorem [ thm",
    ": can ] , we have an orthogonal direct sum decomposition @xmath269 and as an @xmath53-submodule of @xmath268 , @xmath266 is an irreducible @xmath270-module corresponding to the young diagram @xmath271 more precisely , @xmath69-irreducible representation @xmath272 appears in the @xmath69-irreducible decomposition of @xmath273 if and only if @xmath274 and in this case its multiplicity is equal to the dimension of @xmath275 . on the other hand",
    ", each copy of @xmath272 has a unique @xmath5-invariant element ( up to scalars ) and the totality of these @xmath5-invariant elements makes a basis of the subspace @xmath266 .",
    "now it was shown in @xcite ( see also proposition [ prop : chah ] below ) that the space @xmath276 is the image of certain projecting operator acting on @xmath273 which is an element of @xmath277 $ ] .",
    "more precisely , we have @xmath278 by restricting to the @xmath5-invariant subspaces , we have @xmath279 since this operator is described in terms of the action of the symmetric group , it sends each subspace @xmath266 to itself .",
    "hence if we define @xmath280 we obtain the required orthogonal decomposition .",
    "finally , the formula for the dimension of @xmath46 follows by applying corollary 3.2 of @xcite because @xmath281 is equal to the multiplicity of @xmath272 in @xmath276 .",
    "this completes the proof .",
    "as was mentioned in our paper @xcite , we have determined the @xmath5-irreducible decompositions of @xmath72 for all @xmath131 . by combining this with theorem [ thm : ortho ]",
    ", we have determined the orthogonal decompositions of @xmath30 for all @xmath63 .",

    ", @xmath30 is a submodule of @xmath31 so that the stable range of @xmath30 is smaller than or equal to @xmath313 .",
    "now , as was mentioned in @xcite , proposition 4.1 , for any young diagram @xmath32 @xmath314 let @xmath315 $ ] be a young diagram with @xmath55 boxes and @xmath37 rows and assume that it is with multiple double floors .",

    "[ prop : ipq ]    @xmath318 follows from that the following three facts .",
    "the first is that the isotypical component @xmath622 is @xmath223-stable which follows from the classical construction of this component .",
    "the second is that the submodule @xmath623 is @xmath223-stable .",
    "the third is that taking the contractions to any given  direction \" is an @xmath223-stable operation .",
    "the rest of the assertions follow similarly using the facts that @xmath624 is @xmath418-stable and the bracket operation of @xmath1 is @xmath223-stable in an obvious sense .    in general , the @xmath5-invariant part of the johnson image @xmath625 is neither @xmath223-stable nor @xmath418-stable , and @xmath619 is not @xmath223-stable .",
    "these can be checked by direct computation .",
    "this is one of the reasons why the problem of determining ( the @xmath5-invariant part of ) the image of the johnson homomorphism as well as the ideal @xmath10 is difficult . in a trial to overcome this difficulty , in section [ sec : hsp ] we introduce two kinds of bases for @xmath30",
    "in this section , we describe a general method of constructing elements of @xmath30 and by using it we introduce two kinds of bases for it .",
    "let @xmath626 be the cyclic permutation as before .",
    "define two elements @xmath627 in @xmath587 $ ] .",
    "then by combining proposition [ prop : chah ] with proposition [ prop : lcd ] , we obtain the following result .",
    "@xmath628 [ prop : lcdh ]    thus we obtain a method of constructing elements of @xmath30 .",
    "we remark here that computation by a computer is much easier in this context of @xmath629 rather than that of @xmath31 because in the latter case the dimension gets very large quickly as the genus grows while in the former context the computation is independent of the genus .",
    "in particular , the explicit orthogonal decomposition of @xmath31 can be obtained by applying various young symmetrizers on @xmath629 to obtain the corresponding decomposition of this space and then converting it to the space @xmath31 by applying proposition [ prop : lcd ] . to obtain the orthogonal decomposition of @xmath30 ,",
    "it is enough to apply further the operator @xmath630 to the above decomposition of @xmath629 and then apply the homomorphism @xmath243 .",
    "more precisely , the explicit procedure goes as follows . by theorem [ thm :",
    "lcdortho ] , there exists an orthogonal direct sum decomposition @xmath631 in terms of certain subspaces @xmath257 . as an @xmath53-submodule of @xmath632",
    ", @xmath257 is an irreducible @xmath53-module corresponding to the young diagram @xmath633 since the operator @xmath634 belongs to @xmath277 $ ] , if we define @xmath635 then @xmath636 is a subspace of @xmath257 and @xmath637    thus we obtain a method of constructing elements of @xmath30 which respects the orthogonal decomposition and is also independent of the genus @xmath3 . indeed , if we choose a basis @xmath638 of @xmath636 and set @xmath639 .",
    "then @xmath640 is a basis of @xmath30 in the stable range .",
    "we call this a _ @xmath418-stable basis _ because it is clearly @xmath418-stable in the obvious sense .",
    "this basis is suitable for describing @xmath619 which is @xmath418-stable .",
    "however , it is not @xmath223-stable ( in fact no basis can be @xmath223-stable ) and the description of @xmath641 is rather complicated . in order to analyze this point , define a linear mapping @xmath642 by setting @xmath643 we use the same notation @xmath644 for the restriction of the above mapping to the subspace @xmath645 as well as its further restriction to the subspace @xmath646",
    ".    @xmath647 the linear mapping @xmath644 is @xmath223-stable in the sense that the following diagram is commutative @xmath648    @xmath649 the linear mapping @xmath650 is injective for any @xmath3 .",
    "furthermore two subspaces @xmath651 and @xmath652 are mutually orthogonal to each other with respect to the usual euclidean metric on @xmath629 which is induced by taking @xmath653 as an orthonormal basis .",
    "@xmath654 for any element @xmath655 , we have the equality @xmath656 [ prop : k ]    @xmath318 follows from the fact that the contraction is an @xmath223-stable operation .",
    "the former part of @xmath322 holds because any @xmath5-invariant tensor is detected by some iterated contractions .",
    "the latter part follows from a stronger statement proved in @xcite that two subspaces @xmath657 and @xmath658 are mutually orthogonal to each other with respect to the usual euclidean metric .",
    "@xmath323 follows similarly because it is proved in the above cited paper that the equality @xmath659 holds for any @xmath660 .",
    "let @xmath661 be any specified subspace , e.g. @xmath662 .",

    ".    @xmath87 the subspace @xmath667 is @xmath418-stable so that the description of it in terms of a @xmath418-stable basis is constant with respect to @xmath3 .",
    "@xmath96 in contrast with the case @xmath318 above , the subspace @xmath668 is not @xmath418-stable .",
    "however , it is _ weighted stable _ in the following sense .",
    "namely the description of it in terms of a normalized basis is constant with respect to @xmath3 .",
    "[ thm : imtauw ]    it remains to prove the last claim of @xmath322 .",
    "the set of values under @xmath644 of @xmath669 is constant with respect to @xmath3 in the stable range .",
    "on the other hand , proposition [ prop : k ] @xmath323 shows that the value under @xmath644 of each member of a @xmath418-stable basis is the corresponding eigenvalue times a constant vector . since the normalized basis cancels exactly this factor , the claim holds .",

    "in this section , we give tables for the orthogonal decompositions of @xmath30 for the cases @xmath944 .",

    "( 1995 ) 201213 .",
    "s.  morita , _ a linear representation of the mapping class group of orientable surfaces and characteristic classes of surface bundles _ , from :  proceedings of the taniguchi symposium on topology and teichmller spaces \" , held in finland , july 1995 , world scientific ( 1996 ) 159186 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we study the structure of the symplectic invariant part @xmath0 of the lie algebra @xmath1 consisting of symplectic derivations of the free lie algebra generated by the rational homology group of a closed oriented surface @xmath2 of genus @xmath3 .    </S>",
    "<S> first we describe the orthogonal direct sum decomposition of this space which is induced by the canonical metric on it and compute it explicitly up to degree @xmath4 . in this framework </S>",
    "<S> , we give a general constraint which is imposed on the @xmath5-invariant component of the bracket of two elements in @xmath1 . </S>",
    "<S> second we clarify the relations among @xmath1 and the other two related lie algebras @xmath6 and @xmath7 which correspond to the cases of a closed surface @xmath8 with and without base point @xmath9 . in particular , based on a theorem of labute , we formulate a method of determining these differences and describe them explicitly up to degree @xmath4 . </S>",
    "<S> third , by giving a general method of constructing elements of @xmath0 , we reveal a considerable difference between two particular submodules of it , one is the @xmath5-invariant part of a certain ideal @xmath10 and the other is that of the johnson image .    finally we combine these results to determine the structure of @xmath1 completely up to degree @xmath11 including the unstable cases where the genus @xmath12 case has an independent meaning . </S>",
    "<S> in particular , we see a glimpse of the galois obstructions explicitly from our point of view . </S>"
  ]
}
